#Text=Belize City
#Text=Belize City is the largest city in Belize .
#Text=It is on a small peninsula protruding into the Caribbean Sea .
#Text=It was the capital city until flooding and other damage from a hurricane in 1961 prompted the government to relocated to Belmopan , closer to the geographic center of the country .
#Text=By plane

#Text=Philip S. W. Goldson International Airport ( BZE ) , Belize City ( about 30 minutes drive ( 15 km ) northwest of Belize City centre in the village of Ladyville ) , ☏ +501 225-2045 , ✉ bacc@pgiabelize.com .

#Text=BZE is connected from the U.S. ( American , Delta , United , and Southwest ) ; from Central America ( Avianca El Salvador , Transportes Aéreos Guatemaltecos and Copa ) and from the surrounding regions of Belize , the Yucatan Peninsula and from Flores by Maya Island Air and Tropic Air .
#Text=There are seasonal flights offered from Canada with Air Canada Rouge and Westjet .
#Text=The best way to get to and from the city centre is by taxi .

#Text=If going to San Ignacio see " By shuttle " in the below as there are shuttle companies based in San Ignacio that offer airport transfers to San Ignacio and to the surrounding areas in the Cayo District .
#Text=Some may connect the airport to other places such as the water taxi terminals in Belize City or Placencia from the airport without going to San Ignacio .
#Text=Ask .
#Text=An airport bus service does exist , but it is very infrequent and unreliable .
#Text=Sir Barry Bowen Municipal Airport ( TZA ) .
#Text=Flights from regional airports .
#Text=By water taxis
#Text=Ocean Ferry Belize , 50 N Front St ( Along Front Street at the northeast end of the Swing Bridge ) , ☏ +501 223-0033 , +501 233-0033 , +501 223-2033 .
#Text=Connects Belize City to Caye Chapel , Caye Caulker and San Pedro

#Text=San Pedro Express ( http://www.belizewatertaxi.com ) , 111 N Front St ( behind a marketplace that is 250 m east along Front St from the Swing Bridge & the Ocean Ferry Belize Terminal ) , ☏ +501 223-2225 .
#Text=Connects Belize City to Caye Caulker and San Pedro Town .
#Text=They have a once daily connection from Caye Caulker and from San Pedro to Chetumal .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Buses from Santa Elena/Flores in Guatemala ( 2-3 hr ) arrive at the San Pedro Express water taxi terminal at 111 N Front St while the ADO bus to Mexico are at the Novelo 's bus terminal .
#Text=See the below :
#Text=Atlanta Tour & Express Bus , 111 N Front St ( Inside the San Pedro Belize Express Water Taxi Terminal ) .
#Text=Arrange onward transport to Flores with Linea Dorada or Fuente Del Norte ( FDN )
#Text=Mundo Maya Travels , Suite #26 , Brown Sugar Market Place
#Text=90 Front St ( 250 m east along Front St from the Swing Bridge & the Ocean Ferry Belize Terminal . ) , ☏ +501 223-1200 .
#Text=They sell tickets for onward travel to Guatemala by Fuente Del Norte ( FDN ) and San Juan Express .
#Text=They may also sell tickets for Linea Dorada and ADN as well .
#Text=S & L Travel & Tours , 91 N Front St ( Same building as Image Factory , Next to Spoonaz Coffee ) , ☏ +501 227-7593 .
#Text=They offer tours to different places around the region as well shuttle transportation to Tikal , Flores and Cancun
#Text=Grupo ADO , Novelos Bus Terminal @ W Collett Canal St. Once nightly departure to/from Cancun and Merida .
#Text=Various
#Text=from Novelos Bus Terminal
#Text=, Novelos Bus Terminal @ W Collett Canal St ( W Collett Canal St and King St ) .
#Text=Bus travel is a very common mode of transportation in Belize for going to work , shopping and other errands .
#Text=Therefore , bus service along the main highways is frequent , usually hourly and sometimes half-hourly during peak travel times .
#Text=For service to/from small rural towns off the main highway they can be less frequent to as little as 4 times or twice daily and no service on Sundays .

#Text=Like the famous chicken buses in Guatemala , they operate in the recycled U.S. school buses , but they can also be in the older MCI ( Motor Coach Industries ) buses ( intercity buses used by Greyhound and other companies in the U.S. , usually for " express " services ) .
#Text=They are usually not crowded , but they can be too .
#Text=The services provided are either " regular " which means they stop anywhere along the road to pick up and let off passengers and " express " with only scheduled stops in major towns .
#Text=The companies and drivers ' unions do n't have websites or published schedules like they do in Mexico and the " west " .
#Text=If they do , it 's usually handwritten on a piece of paper or cardboard and taped to a wall or bus station window for all to see at the bus station .
#Text=The buses do display the final destination or a list of major destinations served on the windshield .
#Text=By shuttle
#Text=Shuttles can pick you up at the airport , your hotel or from anywhere , and transfer you much quicker to almost anywhere in the country and with much more ease since they are door to door :
#Text=Belize Ground Shuttle
#Text=The only shared shuttle service in Belize with daily scheduled airport service .
#Text=email : belizegroundshuttle@gmail.com
#Text=Ron 's Belize Shuttle .
#Text=Specializing in private shuttle service to any destination in Belize .
#Text=email : belizetraveladvisory@gmail.com
#Text=Elies Guerras Transfer Service ( Belize Shuttle Service ) , Belize City , ☏ +501 666-9834 , ✉ info@guerratransfers.com .
#Text=An easy way of getting to and from Belize City , Shuttle can be done on your time .
#Text=Shuttle is Reliable and on-time for transfer at Any Resort or Hotel .
#Text=Teddy Bear Shuttle , ( office ) #17 San Ignacio Town , Cayo , ☏ +501 600-2695 , +501 667-1441 .
#Text=Teddy Bear shuttle and taxi service is safe and reliable , you can find him just behind the Belize Bank in the center of San Ignacio Town .
#Text=Mayan Heart World , ( office ) 29 Burns Ave , San Ignacio Town , Cayo District .
#Text=Offers private shuttle transfers from San Ignacio , Belize western border to Flores or Tikal in Peten , Guatemala .
#Text=The company even have the ability to transfer you to just about any where from San Ignacio Town .
#Text=Belize Shuttle Co , ☏ +501 666-7268 , toll-free : +1 888 398-1914 ( US ) .
#Text=It has an outstanding record of transporting you to and from your destination on-time .
#Text=Your Belize Shuttle Driver is Denfield Gomez , known locally as Denny , maintain an impeccable driving recorder when it comes to shuttling you to or from your destination .
#Text=http://www.sanignacioshuttles.com/ , ( office ) 22 Burns Ave , San Ignacio City , ☏ +501-628-7037 .
#Text=Operated by Sergio Paiz , runs to all major shuttle destination in Belize , Located on Burns Ave , San Ignacio Town .
#Text=Williams Belize Shuttle , ☏ +501 620-3055 .
#Text=A door to door shuttle .
#Text=Airport shuttle service to Belize City , San Ignacio and any other destination in Belize .
#Text=Most of them are based in San Ignacio Town , east of Belize City in the Cayo District and wrote about connecting San Ignacio to the airport and other places in Belize .
#Text=Therefore , you must ask them if they provide transportation originating in Belize City and going somewhere else if you do n't plan to go to San Ignacio .
